diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Posterior scleritis associated with Borrelia burgdorferi infection
differential_diagnosis: Orbital and intraocular tumors (e.g., malignant melanoma, choroidal metastasis)
Other infectious causes (e.g., Herpes zoster, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Toxoplasmosis)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by the patient's history of tick bites and erythema migrans, along with serologic testing showing immunoglobulin M antibodies against B. burgdorferi. Imaging studies revealed a large scleral mass with associated ocular symptoms. Treatment with corticosteroids led to rapid improvement, suggesting an autoimmune mechanism.
